site_name: Out of Africa Wildlife Park, LLC

citations.narrative:
It was observed that the public may be able to make contact with 2 adult African Crested Porcupines (Thimble and
Needles) while they were in their primary enclosure due to absent barrier measures. No attendant is present at this
enclosure nor is there a physical barrier between the primary enclosure and the general public. There is an approximately
3.5 feet long gap measuring 2 inches wide in the primary enclosure fencing located approximately 2.5 feet from ground
surface that allows the public to stick a hand through. The animals were observed sniffing the gap area and being able to
reach the gap. The primary enclosure wall is constructed of solid metal paneling approximately 3 feet tall with an inward
tilted metal mesh panel topper measuring approximately 18 inches tall. A member of the public may be able to reach over
the primary enclosure fencing to make contact with animals. Failure to provide sufficient distance and/or barriers between
the animal and the viewing public may pose a risk of harm to the animal and to the public. A sufficient barrier system must
be in place to assure the safety of all animals and the public.
Correct by 17 January 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
It was observed that the public may be able to make contact with 2 adult African Crested Porcupines (Thimble and 
Needles) while they were in their primary enclosure due to absent barrier measures. No attendant is present at this 
enclosure nor is there a physical barrier between the primary enclosure and the general public. There is an approximately 
3.5 feet long gap measuring 2 inches wide in the primary enclosure fencing located approximately 2.5 feet from ground 
surface that allows the public to stick a hand through. The animals were observed sniffing the gap area and being able to 
reach the gap. The primary enclosure wall is constructed of solid metal paneling approximately 3 feet tall with an inward 
tilted metal mesh panel topper measuring approximately 18 inches tall. A member of the public may be able to reach over 
the primary enclosure fencing to make contact with animals. Failure to provide sufficient distance and/or barriers between 
the animal and the viewing public may pose a risk of harm to the animal and to the public. A sufficient barrier system must 
be in place to assure the safety of all animals and the public. 
 
Correct by 17 January 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
